title: Executive Assistant
description:
Executive Assistant - Global Financial Services

Join a globally respected financial services firm known not just for its high performance, but for its incredible culture and show-stopping offices. We’re on the lookout for a Executive Assistant to support a high-calibre team, including Senior Managing Directors and VPs—people at the top of their game.

This is more than just a traditional EA role. You’ll be a key player, helping to keep the gears moving smoothly in a fast-paced, high-stakes environment, where your expertise is respected and your contributions truly matter.

What You’ll Be Doing:
Seamlessly support a dynamic team of senior leaders.
Manage highly complex calendars and juggle competing priorities.
Organise detailed global travel itineraries with precision.
Act as a trusted point of contact internally and externally.
Help nurture an inclusive, energising team culture.

What We're Looking For:
Solid experience as an Executive Assistant—financial services experience is highly desired.
High level ability to manage schedules and travel across time zones.
A curious, solution-focused mindset—you’re always one step ahead.
Next-level organisation and multitasking skills.
Strong emotional intelligence and top-tier communication skills.

Why You’ll Love It Here:
A collaborative, respectful, and people-first culture—you’ll feel valued from day one.
Career growth and learning opportunities that will keep you challenged and inspired.
Hybrid flexibility (3 days in-office, 2 remote).
A competitive salary + benefits package that recognises your worth.
industries: Financial Services, Investment Banking, and Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals

title: Business Analyst
description:
Business Analyst – Birmingham

Birmingham – Hybrid 3 days

Salary - £50,000 - £60,000 per annum

Our client is seeking a highly skilled Business Analyst to join an existing BA team. In this role, you will act as a crucial link between business needs and technical solutions, ensuring seamless alignment across various sectors. Your efforts will focus on enhancing processes and delivering impactful results. The role will support a range of IT projects, encompassing both application and infrastructure-related initiatives.


Key Skills and Responsibilities:

- Proven track record working on business change and business projects as a Business Analyst
- Conduct thorough and detailed analysis of current business processes, employing process mapping tools and methodologies to identify inefficiencies and optimisation opportunities.
- Build and maintain strong, collaborative relationships across various business units, ensuring clear, consistent, and transparent communication. Engage with stakeholders at all levels to align business objectives and ensure their needs and expectations are met.
- Lead and facilitate comprehensive workshops, in-depth interviews, and interactive focus groups to meticulously capture, document, and validate detailed business requirements.
- Collaborate closely with technical teams, including software developers, system architects, and IT specialists, to translate complex business needs into actionable and practical technical solutions.
- Identify and implement opportunities for process optimisation and continuous improvement using Agile methodology. Develop and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of process improvements and deliver measurable business benefits.
- Law or Finance background is advantageous

Interested? Please submit your updated CV to Emma Siwicki at Crimson or immediate consideration.
Not interested? Do you know someone who might be a perfect fit for this role? Refer a friend and earn £250 worth of vouchers!

Crimson is acting as an employment agency regarding this vacancy

title: Data Acquisition Lead
description:
We are working with a leading insurance organsiation who are looking for a Data Acquisition Lead to play a key role in supporting their data lake and lakehouse architecture strategy. You will work closely with data architects and data scientists to acquire and document production-ready data sources, utilising modern methods and tools in line with best practice.

Key Responsibilities
Collaborate with data engineers, architects, and scientists to source and integrate corporate data assets.
Support the development of scalable and efficient data pipelines (ETL/ELT), ensuring data is clean, transformed, and ready for analytics.
Drive the acquisition and sharing of data for counter-fraud and strategic insight purposes.
Apply best-in-class data documentation and governance principles.
Work within the framework of data protection and information governance, ensuring compliance with relevant legislation.
Build strong stakeholder relationships to secure strategic data assets.

About You
You are someone who brings strong technical knowledge combined with stakeholder and project management skills. You understand the complexity of data across large, multi-functional organisations and know how to turn strategy into practical, operational outcomes.

Required Experience
Proven experience in acquiring, processing, and sharing data in large or complex organisations.
Strong background in data engineering and ETL development.
Experience working with diverse data sources and building production-ready pipelines.
Solid understanding of data protection laws and governance frameworks.
Track record of influencing stakeholders and managing cross-functional relationships.
Experience in delivering reports and dashboards for performance and analytical use.
Familiarity with data science and analytics concepts.

Key Skills
Strong analytical and numerical reasoning.
Deep understanding of data structures and database management.
Confident problem solver with innovative and strategic thinking abilities.
Excellent communication, influencing, and negotiation skills.
Ability to balance multiple priorities and deliver under pressure.
Skilled in translating strategic objectives into actionable plans.
industries: Insurance, Financial Services, and Business Consulting and Services

title: IT Business Analyst
description:
Job Overview:
Our client is looking for an IT Business Analyst to join their team. The role involves a focus on identifying opportunities for innovation, optimising processes, and ensuring the successful implementation of technology-driven solutions

Key Responsibilities
Partner with the IT Director to assess and enhance the firm’s legal services through technological advancements and process improvements.
Develop and present comprehensive project plans to the Strategy Board, outlining objectives, scope, timelines, and resource needs.
Conduct in-depth research and analysis to support project proposals and strategic recommendations.
Lead and oversee project initiatives, ensuring adherence to agreed-upon processes and timelines.
Track project progress and provide regular status updates to the IT Director.
Work collaboratively with the Development, Infrastructure, and Operations teams to design, configure, and deploy necessary systems and tools.
Coordinate with the training team to organize workshops and training sessions, ensuring a smooth transition to new technologies and processes.
Assess the effectiveness of implemented projects, reporting on outcomes and applying lessons learned to future initiatives.

Person Specification
Proven experience as a Business Analyst within professional services.
A successful track record in delivering internal consultancy projects.
Experience collaborating with cross-functional teams and managing stakeholders.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
Strong organizational skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Demonstrated experience in business process optimization and technology implementation.
A results-driven mindset with accountability for project outcomes.

Details
Full time
Hybrid working (4 days onsite, 1 day offsite)
Paying £60,000

title: Senior Data/Analytics Engineer
description:
💻 Job Title: Senior Data/Analytics Engineer
💰 Salary: up to £115k
🌴 38 days of annual leave + bank holidays
🔗 Industry: B2B2C platform
📍 Location: could be mostly remote
ideally in close proximity to London or Edinburgh to visit the office on weekly basis, however, open to only monthly visits to either office

With 1.1 million members and over 300 corporate clients (including the likes of Amazon, Google and HSBC to name just a few), this rapidly growing data and technology platform is a UK leader in their field.

As the company's first dedicated Data hire, working directly under the CTO, you'll establish the foundation for their data infrastructure and analytics capabilities. This is a unique opportunity to build and shape the data landscape from the ground up, working closely with cross-functional teams to enable data-driven decision-making across the organisation.

This pivotal role sits somewhere between Data Engineering and Analytics Engineering and will involve:
Designing, developing, and maintaining scalable data models and pipelines to ensure clean, well-structured data for analytics and reporting
Implementing and maintaining ELT/ETL processes using tools like DBT and Fivetran
Owning and optimising data warehousing (Snowflake) and ensuring efficient data management
Collaborating with software engineers, product managers and business stakeholders to understand data needs and deliver high-quality, accessible datasets
Establishing best practices for data governance, quality, documentation and version control
Identifying opportunities to improve data accessibility and driving automation in data workflows

✅ Must have requirements:
Strong proficiency in SQL and DBT
At least intermediate proficiency in Python and Git
Experience designing, building and maintaining data pipelines
Familiarity with date warehousing architecture and implementation
Visualisation experience, ideally with Tableau

👍 Bonus points for:
Experience with Fivetran and Snowflake
Familiarity with cloud infrastructure (ideally AWS)
Experience with Terraform and Docker

🛂 Please note: unfortunately, this role does not offer VISA sponsorship.

title: Business Analyst
description:
Job Title: Business Analyst – IT
Location: London (Hybrid)
Salary: £65,000 + Bonus + Excellent Benefits

Are you an experienced Business Analyst ready to make an impact on high-profile digital transformation initiatives? This is a unique opportunity to join a forward-thinking organisation undergoing a major IT transformation, with a multi-year roadmap to modernise its entire technology estate.

The Opportunity
Our client is delivering a broad portfolio of change across every business function—spanning customer experience, commercial, operations, finance, and HR. With numerous new and ongoing projects, they are expanding their Business Analysis function and looking for skilled professionals to help drive innovation and business value.
You'll play a critical role in bridging the gap between business stakeholders and solution delivery teams, ensuring that requirements are accurately captured, well-understood, and successfully delivered.

What You’ll Be Working On
You'll contribute to projects such as:
Redeveloping customer-facing websites
Driving efficiencies through robotic process automation and AI
Rolling out new IT service management capabilities
Supporting large-scale enterprise integrations with 3rd-party suppliers
Enhancing commercial and operational performance through modern tech solutions

This is part of a wider transformation to a digital-first, cloud-enabled operating model designed to accelerate time-to-value and embed innovation at the core of the business.

About You
You’re a seasoned Business Analyst who thrives in complex, fast-paced environments. You bring a strategic mindset, strong attention to detail, and the ability to align diverse stakeholder groups around a shared vision. You’re also confident navigating both Agile and Waterfall methodologies, and adept at leading cross-functional workshops.

Key Requirements
Proven experience as a Business Analyst within large-scale IT or digital transformation programmes
Track record of working on complex integration projects, especially involving 3rd-party suppliers
Strong stakeholder management and facilitation skills, including experience working with senior business leaders
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Deep experience in process engineering and requirement documentation

We’d love to hear from you even if you don’t meet every requirement!

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
📢Perch Group are searching for a Senior Data Engineer.

At Perch Group, our vision is clear: to lead the UK debt purchase and collection industry by harnessing cutting-edge technology to drive ethical, efficient, and data-driven debt resolution.
Our annual mission is to empower hundreds of thousands of customers to positively engage with and resolve their outstanding debts. We do this through an empathetic and customer-centric approach that is at the heart of our success.

To support our ambitious growth agenda, Perch Group is expanding its development team and seeks a Senior Data Engineer. This permanent role will lead a team focused on delivering robust data solutions across our five businesses. You will leverage your deep expertise in traditional data engineering (database design, T-SQL) and Microsoft Azure's data services (Data Factory, Power BI, and pipelines) to address complex business challenges. We are looking for a candidate who can effectively translate business requirements into technical specifications and guide a team to successful implementation.

💵£60,000-70,000 + up to 20% of your annual salary, paid as a bonus.
📍This role is based at our Blackpool office. We offer hybrid working options.

You'll make a major contribution by demonstrating…

Accountabilities

Technical Leadership & Mentorship
Provide technical leadership and guidance to the data engineering team, fostering a culture of technical excellence and innovation.
Mentor junior engineers, sharing technical expertise and best practices to enhance their skills and knowledge.

Data Architecture & Design
Architect and implement robust designs, ensuring optimal performance, scalability, and security.
Translate high-level solution designs into detailed technical specifications, including data models, ETL processes, and database schemas.
Establish and enforce data modelling best practices, promoting data integrity and consistency across all platforms.

ETL Development & Optimization
Develop and optimize complex ETL pipelines for diverse data sources (on-premise and cloud-based), utilizing best practices for data extraction, transformation, and loading.
Implement data quality checks and validation processes within ETL pipelines, ensuring data accuracy and reliability.
Optimize ETL performance for speed and efficiency, addressing bottlenecks and improving data processing times.

Data Platform Management & Governance
Maintain and enhance the company's data platforms, ensuring high availability, performance, and security.
Implement data governance policies and procedures, ensuring compliance with data quality standards and regulatory requirements.
Design and implement data observability and data quality monitoring solutions, enabling proactive identification and resolution of data issues.

Measures

ETL Performance Metrics
Measured by ETL pipeline execution time, throughput, and resource utilization.
Performance of database query optimisation and data retrieval.

Data Quality & Accuracy
Measured by data accuracy rates, data validation pass rates, and the number of data quality incidents.
Accuracy of business logic and ETL conversion.

Delivery Efficiency & Timeliness
Measured by the speed and efficiency of data solution delivery, including adherence to project timelines and milestones.
Speed of delivery.

Code Quality & Reusability
Measured by code review metrics, adherence to coding standards, and the level of code reusability.

Behaviours

Technical Passion & Innovation
Demonstrates a strong passion for data technologies and a commitment to staying up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices.
Proactively seeks out opportunities to improve data processes and leverage new technologies.

Problem-Solving & Best Practices
Possesses a strong problem-solving mindset, with the ability to identify and resolve complex technical challenges.
Adheres to and promotes data engineering best practices, ensuring code quality, performance, and maintainability.

Continuous Learning & Growth
Embraces a growth mindset, with a strong desire for continuous learning and professional development.
Actively seeks out opportunities to expand technical skills and knowledge.

Technical Communication & Collaboration
Communicates technical concepts clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Collaborates effectively with cross-functional teams, fostering a positive and productive work environment.
Confident communicator, who can articulate problems and solutions just as clearly to the executive team as to engineering teams.



You should apply for this role if you have the following experience…

Essential

Minimum 5+ years of experience in designing and implementing data ETL processes and design.
Expert-level proficiency in T-SQL, SSIS, and the Microsoft data stack (SQL Server, Azure SQL Database).
Proven experience in designing and implementing data models and database schemas for complex data environments.
Strong understanding of data quality principles and best practices, with experience implementing data governance policies.
Demonstrated ability to troubleshoot and resolve complex data-related issues.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong teamwork, interpersonal and collaboration skills with colleagues and clients.

Desirable

Proficiency in Azure Active Directory for managing identities and service principals.
Experience with Azure DevOps for CI/CD pipeline development and data operations (DataOps).
Experience with Python or other relevant coding languages.
Experience with Data Observability tools.


⌛️The Application Timeline

A first stage video call with the internal recruitment team (15 minutes)
A second stage call with the hiring manager (15 minutes)
A face to face or video call with the hiring manager (45 minutes - 60 minutes)

Typically, the average successful applicant will be within this timeline for 2-3 weeks. Please note we will close this role once we have enough applications for the next stages therefore you should submit your application asap to avoid any disappointment.

If you do not receive a response after 3 weeks of applying, please assume you have been unsuccessful as we may experience a high volume of applications.

If you have any questions or suggestions of how we can assist you in your application due to disability or personal reasons, please email recruitment@perchgroup.co.uk.

What’s In It For You

💵 £60,000-70,000 + up to 20% of your annual salary, paid as a bonus.
📍This role is based at our Blackpool office. We offer hybrid working options.
⏰ 37.5 hours per week. We offer flexible working hours between our core hours of 8am- 6pm, Monday to Friday.
🎓 The opportunity to complete formal qualifications and learn on the job in a successful, growing organisation.
➕ And many more benefits to support your wellbeing and professional development.

We are an equal opportunities employer

We’re an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to age, ethnicity, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, or veteran, neurodiversity or disability status.

At Perch, our strength lies in our team, their enthusiasm, and their passion for the business. Whether you’re looking to gain foundational skills in financial services, have a knack for customer service, or seek to expand your horizons, we likely have the perfect opportunity for you.

title: Data Protection Officer
description:
The Role:

To lead, develop, implement, revise and oversee the c2c data protection programme. The successful candidate will be responsible for implementing policies and procedures, and monitoring compliance and data practices internally, to ensure the business and its functions comply with the requirements of applicable data protection regulations and that the compliance programme is effective in preventing, identifying, detecting, and correcting any non-compliance.
Responsibilities:
Managing compliance with statutory requirements imposed by the Data Protection Act (DPA 2018) and other applicable UK data protection legislation / regulations.
Develop and update data protection policies and procedures ensuring compliance with legislation and incorporating the Information Commissioner’s Office best practice and guidance.
Review tender and new supplier submissions with other relevant functions including procurement and information security teams.
Management of data protection assessment’s including providing advice and guidance to ensure risks are mitigated to an acceptable level.
Management of the process for data subjects to exercise their individual data rights and manage the response process.
Performing duties and obligations pertaining to privacy compliance for the business.
Management of the data protection employee training and awareness framework.
Manage the completion of Freedom of Information requests.
Manage an assurance program and related audits.
Conduct data protection impact assessments (DPIAs)
Oversee the maintenance of records (Processing Activities / ICO’s Accountability Framework etc.) required to demonstrate DP compliance.
Implement the data incident response and data breach notification procedures, making an assessment whether a personal data breach meets the threshold for escalation to the ICO and support with risk mitigation advice.
Manage the relationships with, and company reporting to, relevant Data Protection Authorities.
Management of the data protection team to ensure compliance goals are achieved.

Skills Required:

Expert knowledge of relevant data privacy legislation and enforcement regimes in the UK, and a good understanding of other major privacy frameworks.
Sufficient knowledge of information technology and data management systems required.
Ability to effectively communicate data protection issues to senior managers, employees, and data subjects and building strong relationships with stakeholders.
Ability to manage time well, prioritise effectively, and handle multiple deadlines.
Pragmatic in devising actions and solutions to mitigate privacy risks.
Strong influencing skills to obtain management commitment to implement mitigating actions.
Able to gain a detailed understanding of the business and assess c2c’s internal/external risk profile and regulatory obligations.
Good people management skills, able to motivate, inspire and coach staff effectively.
Ability to manage confidential and sensitive information with the appropriate
discretion.
Ability to work independently/autonomously avoiding any conflicts of interest.

Required Experience:
Data Protection and/or Privacy certification such as, IAPP CIPP-E, CIPM, essential. Looking to work towards the Certified AI Governance Professional (AIGP)
Proven experience in developing and implementing data protection policies, procedures, and processes to ensure compliance with data protection legislation.
Post qualifying experience in managing or advising on similar programmes essential.
Strong understanding of risk management.
Knowledge of Freedom of Information Act 2000, Human Rights Act 1998, Protection of Freedom Act 2012, Data Protection Act (DPA 2018) and the United Kingdom - General Data Protection Regulation (UK-GDPR).
Experience in developing policy and compliance training.
Experience in dealing with Data Protection Authorities and industry bodies.
Experience in managing data incidents and breaches.
Knowledge of cybersecurity risks and information security standards.

Data Governance Business Partner
The Role:
The Data Governance Business Partner will be responsible for implementing data protection policies, managing data breach responses, conducting regular audits, training sessions, records of processing activities, data protection assessments and supporting the DPO in compliance activities.
Responsibilities:
Reviewing and update of data protection related policies and procedures.
Participation and taking the lead in the production and regular review of Data Protection Impact Assessments, Legitimate Interest Assessments, Transfer Risk Assessments, Supplier Assessments and maintaining an up-to-date Accountability Framework Assessment.
Day to day management of Subject Access Requests and Freedom of Information Requests.
Reviewing with relevant line managers and data owners the businesses Records of Processing Activities.
Produce and manage data protection training material. Deliver training face to face and or on-line to employees at all levels of the business.
Assist in managing, recording and reporting of any personal data incidents.
Skills Required:
Knowledge of UK data privacy legislation and enforcement regimes.
Broad knowledge of information technology and data management systems and procedures.
Good communications skills at all levels.
Management of time critical activities, priorities affectively and able to achieve multiple deadlines for activities and tasks.
Able to prepare training material and undertake training of others.
Experience Required:
Data Protection and/or Privacy certification such as, IAPP CCIP-E and CIPM essential.
Previous experience of working in a data protection role.
Previous experience in data protection assessments.
Familiarity with data processing systems, information security practices and technical measures to protect personal data.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
💻 Job Title: Senior Data Engineer
💰 Salary: up to ~£110k + very generous equity (of the same value as your salary!)
📍 Location: Shoreditch (2 office days/week)
💵 Industry: FinTech / Payments

Having raised over £7m at seed stage, this FinTech company is shaking up the payments space with their innovative real-time price comparison solutions, making card payments a lot fairer and cheaper for smaller businesses and their customers 🤝

With a host of very impressive investors backing this venture, and working in collaboration with the world's largest players in payments, this company is causing the biggest change to how businesses access card payments in over two decades.

As the company is gearing up for Series A funding, they're looking expand their Data team to leverage a vast amount of data they're collecting from their clients on daily basis and turn this into valuable insights and analytics.

✅ Must have requirements:
Python
SQL
Expertise designing and maintaining ETL/data pipelines
Cloud infrastructure - AWS is highly desirable, but GCP and Azure backgrounds are also ok
Terraform
Experience working in a small, fast-growing start-up (ideally having gone from Seed to Series A growth stage)

👍 Bonus points for:
Familiarity with AI / experience working with AI products
Experience with data orchestration and data warehousing
Experience with DBT
Understanding of Business Intelligence and Data Science
Strong academic background

🛂 Please note: unfortunately, this role does not offer VISA sponsorship.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
Senior Data Engineer
Location: London | Hybrid
Tech Stack: Azure | Synapse | Databricks | Power BI
Cloud Focus: Cloud-native + hybrid integration
Salary: £80,000 - £100,000 + 20% bonus

We’re hiring a Senior Data Engineer on behalf of a global financial services firm undergoing large-scale digital and cloud transformation. This role sits at the intersection of cloud-native architecture and legacy system integration, and is critical to building scalable, secure data solutions using the Azure ecosystem.

You’ll work across modern and hybrid environments, lead pipeline development, and play a hands-on role in shaping the firm’s data engineering framework — with real impact on decision-making, performance, and productivity.
What You’ll Do
Lead the design and build of end-to-end data pipelines on Azure Synapse and Databricks.
Work with DevOps and Architecture teams to ensure seamless integration between cloud and legacy on-prem systems.
Contribute to a cloud-native data engineering framework built around a “single version of the truth.”
Create and govern analytical data sets that power self-serve insights across the business.
Deliver clean, secure, and scalable code using SQL, Python, and DAX in a Spark environment.
Collaborate with data architects and analysts to ensure data products are aligned to user needs.
Maintain documentation and champion data quality, validation, and best practices.
Support and mentor engineers, and contribute to code reviews and standards.

What You Bring
Strong hands-on experience with Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Databricks, and Power BI.
Solid SQL and DAX skills; basic Python for Spark environments is a plus.
Experience building pipelines in a lakehouse architecture with hybrid on-prem/cloud data sources.
Knowledge of DevOps concepts within a data engineering environment.
Deep understanding of data modelling, warehousing, and visualisation for analytics.
Exposure to financial services or insurance environments is preferred.
Comfortable navigating complexity, legacy integration challenges, and fast-paced change.

Why This Role?
Own critical engineering work across a modern Azure stack
Influence the integration strategy between legacy systems and cloud platforms
Be part of a business making bold investments in data and technology

Please Apply!

title: Lead Data Engineer
description:
Peaple Talent has partnered with a global digital engineering consultancy who are recruiting for a Lead Data Engineer on a permanent basis based out of their Sunderland office. You will have a great understanding of technology consultancy services along with fantastic communication and stakeholder engagement skills as this role will be client facing.

Skills and experience:
Proven experience as a Lead Data Engineer with a focus on Azure cloud services.
Experience of managing small teams whilst also being hands-on.
Strong database fundamentals including SQL/TSQL, performance and schema design.
Experience architecting and building data applications using Azure, specifically a Data Warehouse and/or Data Lake.
Technologies:
Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Data Lake, Azure Databricks and Power BI. Experience with creating low-level designs for data platform implementations.
ETL pipeline development for the integration with data sources and data transformations including the creation of supplementary documentation.
Proficiency in working with APIs and integrating them into data pipelines.
Strong programming skills in Python.
Experience of data wrangling such as cleansing, quality enforcement and curation e.g. using Azure Synapse notebooks, Databricks, etc.
Experience of data modelling to describe the data landscape, entities and relationships.
Experience with data migration from legacy systems to the cloud.
Experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) particularly with Terraform.
Proficient in the development of Power BI dashboards.
Strong focus on documentation and diagramming (e.g. ERDs).
Strong communication and teamwork skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams effectively.

It would be great if you have:
Azure Data Fundamentals DP-900 certification.
Azure Fundamentals AZ-900 certification.
Good knowledge of data governance, data quality, security, metadata cataloguing and Master Data Management.
Machine Learning and AI development experience

Benefits:
Up to 10% bonus (based on company and personal performance).
An employer pension scheme
25 days holiday + 8 bank holidays, with the option to carry forward or 'cash-in' 5 days each year
Life Insurance & Income protection
Enhanced Maternity Pay & Paternity Pay
Cycle to work scheme
Travel loan scheme
A Tech Scheme which lets you choose from over 5000 tech products at up to a 12% discount
Free unlimited Udemy account for every employee to support their continuous learning and improvement

title: Cyber Incident Response Consultant - UK - £60,000 to £100,000 + bonus + allowance
description:
Cyber Incident Response Consultant | Leading Global Consultancy

Our client, a globally recognised consultancy with one of the most established and high-performing Cyber Incident Response teams in the UK, is looking to hire new incident response talent. As one of only 9 accredited Tier 1 responders in the UK, this team is trusted by major organisations to lead them through complex, high-stakes cyber incidents.

This is a standout opportunity to join a dynamic, growing team at the forefront of cyber defence. You’ll gain broad exposure across industries, work on some of the most significant incidents in the UK, and benefit from top-tier training and certifications.


Key Responsibilities of a Cyber Incident Response Consultant:

Lead and coordinate response efforts for high-impact cyber incidents
Conduct forensic analysis of compromised systems, memory dumps, and network data.
Provide clients with actionable insights on emerging threats and attacker tactics.
Collaborate directly with stakeholders during response and recovery engagements.
Support pre-sales efforts by contributing to bids, proposals, and client pitches.


Key requirements of a Cyber Incident Response Consultant:

Proven hands-on experience managing and investigating cybersecurity incidents. Ideally, 1-5 years in an incident response role.
Solid understanding of networks, operating systems, and key programming/scripting concepts.
Familiarity with a wide range of security frameworks, tools, and methodologies.
Excellent written, presentation, and interpersonal communication skills.


Desirable Extras:

SC or DV clearance, or a willingness to obtain it.
Certifications like;
CREST Certified Incident Manager (CCIM)
GIAC Certified Incident Handler (GCIH)
A degree (ideally postgraduate) in Cyber Security, Information Security, or a related STEM field.

You must be based in the UK to apply and be able to commute into a local office monthly.
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Technology, Information and Internet, and Information Services

title: AI Engineer
description:
Founding Engineer
London (hybrid)
£80,000

About ReCulture:
At ReCulture, we’re not your typical recruitment agency. We’re talent matchmakers - connecting top talent with environments where they’ll thrive. Our approach goes beyond the surface, focusing on behaviours and values as much as skills. Partnering with clients like an in-house team but moving at the speed of an agency, we deliver long-term impact by ensuring the right values fit.

We're looking for a highly skilled and innovative Founding Engineer to join our AI-driven startup. In this pivotal role, you'll take ownership of building and optimising our client’s backend systems, integrating LLM APIs, and ensuring a seamless user experience. If you thrive in a fast-paced, experimental environment and want to shape the future of AI-powered products, this is the opportunity for you.

Key Skills and Responsibilities
Expert-level Python development experience
Previous experience scaling chatbots with multiple agents
Proven experience with LLM APIs (OpenAI, Anthropic, or similar) developing advanced, non-trivial chatbots that go beyond simple LLM API calls, incorporating complex function calling, multi-step workflows, and dynamic tool integrations.
Strong debugging skills.
Experience working with MongoDB for chatbot memory and data storage
Ability to think from a user's perspective, beyond just engineering tasks
Experience integrating eCommerce APIs (Shopify, Wix, BigCommerce)
Develop, optimise, and maintain our architectural improvements for scalability and complex features
Fine-tune LLM APIs (OpenAI, Anthropic, etc.) to enhance chatbot functionality
Debug complex technical issues across frontend, backend, and LLM interactions
Implement prompt chaining and refining techniques to improve chatbot accuracy
Work closely with the team to experiment with new AI tools and APIs (like DeepSeek)
Automate repetitive tasks, improve CI/CD pipelines, and enhance development efficiency.

APPLY NOW or email Elin@re-culture.co.uk

title: Production Support Engineer - Buyside
description:
My client, a global asset manager is looking to hire a Production Support Engineer to join their growing team where you'll provide front-office support across a number of markets.

This role is critical in maintaining the smooth operation of their OMS so if you're passionate about delivering technical support within a fast-paced trading environment whilst being surrounded by an array of talented professionals then this is the role for you.
Requirements

Previous experience supporting trading environments including platforms and internal/external users
Strong knowledge of Linux, FIX protocol and relational databases such as SQL Server
Experience with OMS/PMS
Ability to script in Python and/or Bash is a bonus
Familiarity with asset classes like Equities, Fixed Income, Futures, and FX

title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
description:
AI Engineer – Startup (AI Consultancy) - London (Hybrid) Upto £95k +shares

We’re working with a fast growth AI Consultancy with offices in London, Manchester and Edinburgh. The business is under a year old and currently sitting at 50 people, generating revenue with a range of AI projects including fact extraction, conversational AI, Co-pilots, knowledge graphs, spanning across a variety of clients such as Investments, Insurance, F&B and CPG.

The founders have proven experience in building a consultancy from scratch and exiting, having previously built a Data Science consultancy and successfully sold to a ‘big 4’ , they are on course to replicate their success here.

This has fuelled rapid growth in the team and we are looking for AI Engineers of different experience levels to join us in building the business by developing end2end LLM products for our clients.

What we’re looking for:
We’re looking for people that have experience building production ready AI solutions, to design, build and deploy AI solutions in collaboration with our clients. You’ll be applying some of the SOTA research in AI to develop applications. As such we would expect you to have:

Effective communication skills
Background in foundational Computer Vision/NLP
Strong Software Engineering skills (3 years+)
Developed LLM architecture and deployed LLM applications
Uptodate with current trends in AI
Some experience with applying latest techniques like RAG architecture, GenAI, Parallel training etc

The role is hybrid, with adhoc requirements to be on client premises (London) this could be between 1-5 days a week, so we would need someone that is flexible.
This is a fantastic opportunity to work on a broad range of problems, applying SOTA AI solutions, in a high growth business, set for success and you will be rewarded with:

Base salary of upto £95k
Meaningful EMI shares (our proven history speaks for itself)
25 Days holiday
Statutory pension contribution
Private medical

Please note: you must be eligible to work in the UK to be considered for this position.

Interested?
If you think you fit the bill, get in touch by clicking the ‘apply now’ button or get in touch with me by the following:
Email me at mo@mbnsolutions.com
Call me on 02037736498
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Technology, Information and Media, and Software Development

title: AI Engineer
description:
AI Engineering Consultant - Home-based - £55-60k

Please note - this role requires you to be based in the UK on a permanent basis with the unrestricted right to work in the UK. This organisation is not able to offer sponsorship now or at any time in the future.

A well-respected Microsoft Consulting Partner are looking to recruit for talented AI Engineering Consultants to join their team and grow their AI practice in line with client demand and their strong pipeline of projects.

In this role you will be working as part of an agile team working closely with clients to support them with the implementation and optimisation of the latest AI technologies. As a Consultant you will work with clients to understand their business needs and then design appropriate AI solutions which will ensure success.

This will be a varied and challenging role. Your responsibilities will include:

Work closely with clients to understand their business challenges and opportunities to apply AI driven solutions.
Work as part of a team to develop models and algorithms using AI technologies.
Be an AI tech champion who can provide expertise in AI technologies.
Carry out necessary data analysis to ensure that data is prepared for AI modelling.
Track AI model performance, making necessary amendments.
Provide clients with the necessary training around their AI tools.

To be a good fit for this role you should be an experienced individual who has worked within a data focused tech environment with a passion for AI technologies. You should have the following technical experience:

Experience working within a Microsoft Azure cloud environment.
Strong experience with Python.
Experience with AI & Machine Learning technologies.
AI framework & library experience.

You should have strong communication skills and feel confident dealing directly with clients to be a good fit for this role.

This role offers you the opportunity to work with the latest technologies on fascinating projects within an organisation who will give you the tools to progress and truly invest in your development. Your package will include:

Starting salary of £55-60k perm annum.
Bonus of 10% paid annually.
25 dedicated training days.

To apply for this role please submit your CV or contact David Airey on 0191 338 7508 or at d.airey@tenthrevolution.com.

Tenth Revolution Group are the go-to recruiter for Data & AI roles in the UK offering more opportunities across the country than any other recruitment agency. We're the proud sponsor and supporter of SQLBits, Power Platform World Tour, and the London Fabric User Group. We are the global leaders in Data & AI recruitment.
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and IT System Data Services

title: Corporate Credit Analyst
description:
𝗖𝗿𝗲𝗱𝗶𝘁 𝗥𝗶𝘀𝗸 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗴𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁

Level: AVP
Primary Coverage: Natural Resources - Oil, Gas, Commodity Traders
Job Type: Permanent
Location: London, Hybrid Working
Relevant Experience: Must have Investment Banking / Corporate Banking Experience

We are currently working with a leading global financial institution to recruit an Assistant Vice President (AVP) - Credit Risk Management for their Corporate Credit Risk Team in London. This is a second line of defence role, offering the opportunity to play a critical part in managing and mitigating credit risks across EMEA.

Our client is looking for a proactive and analytical professional to provide oversight and detailed analysis of corporate credit transactions, ensuring robust risk management practices and supporting sustainable growth.

Key Responsibilities
Credit Analysis: Conduct structured reviews of Front Office credit applications, identifying and articulating risk issues and mitigations.
Risk Appetite Communication: Clearly communicate the Credit Department’s risk perception and appetite for transactions, ensuring alignment with bank policies and procedures.
Front Office Collaboration: Act as a trusted partner to Front Office deal teams, providing constructive challenge on risk issues while supporting timely client delivery.
Portfolio Management: Ensure accurate obligor grading and forward-looking risk assessments within your assigned portfolio.
Emerging Risk Monitoring: Proactively monitor and address emerging credit risks in collaboration with Front Office and other risk functions.
Special Credits Oversight: Review Self-Assessment submissions and credit cost provisioning for Special Credits.

Your Background
Qualifications: Degree-level education and/or relevant professional qualifications (e.g., ACA, ACCA, ACT, CFA).
Experience: Some experience in a credit management role (1st or 2nd line), with strong corporate credit analysis skills.
Technical Knowledge: Familiarity with corporate loan products, trade finance products, and derivative products, including relevant documentation.

Skills:
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to prepare clear and concise credit papers.
Strong interpersonal skills, with a collaborative approach to teamwork.
High level of IT literacy and proficiency in risk management tools.

𝕎𝕙𝕪 𝕋𝕙𝕚𝕤 𝕆𝕡𝕡𝕠𝕣𝕥𝕦𝕟𝕚𝕥𝕪?

Hybrid Working: Enjoy the flexibility of hybrid working, balancing office collaboration with remote productivity.
Career Growth: Be part of a dynamic and supportive team, with opportunities for professional development and career progression.
Impactful Work: Play a key role in shaping the bank’s credit risk strategy and ensuring sustainable growth.
Competitive Package: Benefit from a salary of up to £80,000, plus a comprehensive benefits package.
industries: Banking, Investment Banking, and Investment Management

title: Forensic Accountant - Assistant Manager AND Manager
Senior Business Analyst
description:
A boutique alternative investments firm based in London, require a Senior Business Analyst / Systems Analyst to join their investments project team on a permanent basis.

The business are private markets / assets focused and the project teams manages all of the change and transformation initiatives across their technology. They have a suite of alternative investment specific applications that this team support from an implementation and upgrade perspective.

The current major programmes are centered around data transformation, new systems roll outs and target operation model design/implementation.

The ideal candidate will have:

good experience across Private Markets / Assets, Private Credit, Private Debt or Private Equity change and transformation - ESSENTIAL
excellent business analysis skills and experience gained working on investment systems or projects.
good project management and relationship management skills.
good technical skills around SQL, ETL, business intelligence and data transformation.
experience upgrading or implementing new systems / applications
job_function: Analyst, Information Technology, and Project Management

title: Transformation Consultant
description:
Transformation Consultant
Manager, Senior Manager, Director
£80,000 - 140,000
Hybrid, flexible working

I am partnered with a high-growth SaaS organisation in the Energy sector who are heavily growing their transformation consulting team.

They are looking for experienced consultants from Manager to Director grade to join their team to run business transformation projects with their clients. They will work closely with the project and programme managers that complete the tech implementations of the SaaS platform within their clients' businesses, however they support the projects with regards to broader business change elements across the full project lifecycle.

If you are keen to make a move inhouse, this role provide more ownership as you will be more involved post-implementation. There is also no sales element, due to the presence of a separate internal sales team, so this is a delivery-focused role.

Requirements:
Consulting experience, ideally at the Big 4 or similar
Interest to move out of consulting
Experience leading transformation projects, ideally in the energy/utilities/resources/telco sector
Bonus:
Experience with SaaS platforms or tech businesses
Exposure to tech implementation projects
Began in a respected graduate programme

Logistics:
At least 3 days working from home a week
A few days a month in Nottingham
May be some travel to clients

Benefits include pay reviews annually linked to performance, discretionary bonus, private healthcare, and gym membership.

------

Regretfully, due to a high volume of applicants, we are only able to reply to those who are successful.

Equal Opportunities:

We are committed to promoting equality of opportunity for all employees and job applicants. In line with the Equality Act 2010, we strive to create and maintain a working environment in which everyone is able to make the best use of their skills, free from discrimination or harassment, and in which all decisions are based on merit. No person is subjected to any less favourable treatment on any discriminatory grounds on the basis of age, disability, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy and maternity, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation.
industries: Business Consulting and Services, Utilities, and Services for Renewable Energy

title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
Perch Group are searching for a Senior Business Analyst.

At Perch Group, our vision is clear: to lead the UK debt purchase and collection industry by harnessing cutting-edge technology to drive ethical, efficient, and data-driven debt resolution.

Our annual mission is to empower hundreds of thousands of customers to positively engage with and resolve their outstanding debts. We do this through an empathetic and customer-centric approach that is at the heart of our success.

💵 Salary £40,000 - £60,000 DOE + up to 20% of your annual salary, paid as a bonus.
📍 This role can be based at our Blackpool, Skipton, or Manchester offices


Role Overview

As a Senior Business Analyst at Perch Group, you will play a key role in driving strategic change across the organisation by supporting the Transformation Director in shaping the Business Analysis practice within the Change Management Framework. You will work across multiple strategic programmes and smaller projects, ensuring the effective identification, documentation, and delivery of business requirements that align with the company’s objectives.

The role is hybrid, with the opportunity to work from the Blackpool, Skipton, and Manchester offices. The successful candidate will have experience in financial services or a similar regulated environment and will be instrumental in improving the efficiency and effectiveness of project delivery through rigorous business analysis practices.


Key Responsibilities

Business Analysis Framework Development

Support the Transformation Director in developing and refining the Business Analysis practice within the Change Management Framework.
Support with wider CIO Leadership Team in defining the Business Analysis role within an Agile focussed delivery process.
Establish and document best practices, methodologies, and tools for business analysis to ensure consistency and effectiveness.
Define and maintain business analysis standards aligned with industry best practices and regulatory requirements.

Strategic Programme & Project Delivery

Provide business analysis across multiple strategic programmes and smaller projects, ensuring requirements are captured, documented, and communicated effectively.
Collaborate with Business Owners, Project Managers, Scrum Masters, and technical teams to define project scope and objectives.
Conduct detailed process analysis, stakeholder workshops, and data analysis to identify business needs and opportunities.
Translate business requirements into clear, actionable deliverables for development teams and stakeholders.

Process Improvement & Methodology Adherence
Identify opportunities to improve the delivery of strategic programmes and projects through better analysis and adherence to recognised business analysis methodologies.
Ensure effective governance, traceability, and validation of requirements throughout the project lifecycle.
Promote the use of structured techniques such as BPMN, Lean, and Six Sigma where applicable to enhance business processes.
Business Systems & Solution Design
Support the design and development of key business systems and solutions that align with Perch Group’s strategic goals.
Work closely with stakeholders to assess system requirements and recommend optimised solutions.
Facilitate workshops and stakeholder engagement sessions to gather insights and validate solution designs.

Capability Development & Upskilling
Support the upskilling of the Perch Business Analysis capability by mentoring and coaching colleagues.
Assist in developing training materials and frameworks to enhance the effectiveness of business analysis across the organisation.
Share knowledge and insights on best practices, methodologies, and emerging trends in business analysis.


Required Skills and Experience

Business Analysis Expertise
Proven experience as a Senior Business Analyst, preferably within financial services or a regulated industry.
Strong understanding of business analysis methodologies, frameworks, and best practices.
Experience with requirements gathering, process mapping, and solution design.

Stakeholder Management & Communication
Excellent stakeholder engagement skills with the ability to influence and challenge effectively.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to present complex information clearly to different audiences.
Experience working with Business Owners, Transformation teams, and technical teams to align project goals.

Change Management & Process Improvement
Experience in supporting change initiatives and embedding business analysis within structured change frameworks.
Ability to analyse existing business processes and recommend improvements.
Familiarity with Agile, Waterfall, and hybrid project methodologies.

Technical & Analytical Skills
Ability to translate business requirements into functional specifications for technology teams.
Strong data analysis and process mapping skills.
Experience with business analysis tools such as JIRA, Confluence, Visio, or equivalent.

Qualifications
BCS Diploma in Business Analysis or equivalent qualification.
Agile certifications (e.g., Certified Agile Business Analyst, SAFe Agilist) are desirable.
Lean Six Sigma (Green Belt or higher) is advantageous.


What's In It For You

£40,000 - 60,000 DOE + up to 20% of your annual salary, paid as a bonus.
Hybrid working model with flexibility across our Blackpool, Skipton, and Manchester offices.
A collaborative and dynamic work environment.
The opportunity to complete formal qualifications and learn on the job in a successful, growing organisation.
And many more benefits to support your wellbeing and professional development.


We are an equal opportunities employer

We’re an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to age, ethnicity, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, or veteran, neurodiversity or disability status.

At Perch, our strength lies in our team, their enthusiasm, and their passion for the business. Whether you’re looking to gain foundational skills in financial services, have a knack for customer service, or seek to expand your horizons, we likely have the perfect opportunity for you.

title: Supply Chain Analyst
description:
Supply Chain Analyst
Location: West Midlands, UK
Salary: Competitive, based on experience
Type: Full-time

Our client is a leading distribution company with a Pan European presence.
Due to the successful implementation of a bold growth strategy, this has now created an exciting opportunity for a Supply Chain Analyst in the West Midlands!
The Role:
As a Supply Chain Analyst, you will play a crucial role in analysing our end-to-end supply chain, identifying areas for improvement, and driving efficiency gains. You will be responsible for collecting, interpreting, and presenting data to support strategic decision-making and enhance our overall supply chain performance.

Key Responsibilities:
Gather and analyse supply chain data (e.g., procurement, inventory, logistics) to identify trends, patterns, and potential issues.
Identify inefficiencies and bottlenecks within the supply chain and propose data-driven solutions for optimisation.
Evaluate supplier performance and identify opportunities for cost reduction and improved service.
Collaborate with internal teams (e.g., procurement, logistics, sales) to implement process improvements and achieve supply chain objectives.
Support the implementation of new supply chain systems and tools.
Contribute to projects aimed at enhancing supply chain resilience and mitigating risks.

About You:
Proven experience (typically 1-3 years) in a supply chain analysis role or similar analytical position.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data.
Excellent proficiency in data manipulation and analysis tools, particularly Microsoft Excel (advanced level).
Experience with ERP systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle) and data visualisation tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) is highly desirable.
Solid understanding of supply chain principles and best practices.
Strong communication and presentation skills with the ability to convey findings clearly and concisely to various stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
Detail-oriented with a commitment to accuracy.
industries: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage and Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing
